text:
He stood before the door, heart racing. 

He rang the bell again, quietly. 

His mind felt clouded, almost distant. 

Then he heard the latch click open. 

The door creaked, revealing darkness inside. 

He took a breath, steeling himself. 

This moment would haunt him forever.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, in a moment of cunning despite his clouded mind, recalls the vivid moment when he heard the latch of the old woman's door unfastened.
